articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Power Station and Railway Construction
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Power Station and Railway Construction 
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the construction of the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station and the Hyesan-Samjiyon broad-gauge railroad. 
					 Looking round the construction site of the dam at the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station No. 1, the project of the generator chamber at Power Station No. 2 and the broad-gauge railroad construction site, the premier acquainted himself in detail with the construction, preparations for operation and supply of building materials before convening consultative meetings.
					
					 The meetings underlined the significance and importance of the construction of the above-said projects in turning the Samjiyon area into a base for education in the revolutionary traditions. 
					
					 They also underlined the issue of increasing the proportion of machines in use, the issue of ensuring the quality of the construction on the principle of taking responsibility for the safety of the structures and guarantee of their absolute quality for all eternity and the issue of supplying the building materials in a responsible manner under a plan. 
					
					 The premier went round remodeling projects in the Samjiyon Township and took relevant steps.

articles.title: DPRK Government Delegation Leaves for Asian Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Government Delegation Leaves for Asian Countries
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation headed by Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong left here Monday to pay official visits to Malaysia, Thailand and Brunei.
					 Earlier, Ri will attend the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum to be held in Malaysia.

articles.title: Laotian Delegation Here
articles.content:
Laotian Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lao Department of Civil Aviation led by Director Lopangkao Yakva arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Laotian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Laotian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lao Department of Civil Aviation visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday.
					 Members of the delegation laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: KPA Servicepersons Tour Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp
articles.content:
KPA Servicepersons Tour Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the Korean People's Army (KPA) who are taking part in the red flag relay now underway to mark the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation climbed Mt. Paektu Sunday.
					 The relay racers toured the Kim Jong Il's birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp that day.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the mosaic depicting the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and paid tribute to them before visiting the Headquarters log cabin in Sobaeksu valley.
					
					 They looked round the historic relics preserved at the birthplace, being briefed on the fact that Kim Jong Il was born as the son of guerrillas and grew while hearing the gun report as lullaby during the anti-Japanese war.
					
					 Before the monument inscribed with the poem "Shining Star" personally written by Kim Il Sung in praise of Kim Jong Il, they were briefed on it.
					
					 They also went round the shallow well used by anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, trees bearing revolutionary slogans written by her, guerrilla quarters and other places.
					
					 They, divided into groups of the east and west coasts, dynamically ran toward the destination.
					
					 The second group of relay racers held a bonfire gathering near Karim Stream of Pochonbo on Sunday evening.
					
					 The ranks of relay racers visited the Sinpha and Phophyong revolutionary sites on Monday.
					
					 They laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Suk at the revolutionary sites and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: 2015 World Breastfeeding Week Observed
articles.content:
2015 World Breastfeeding Week Observed
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A symposium took place here on Monday on the occasion of the 2015 World Breastfeeding Week.
					 Present there were officials in the field of public health, those of ministries and national institutions, those in the field of media, and the representative of the UNICEF and members of missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Speakers said that the importance of breastfeeding is underscored worldwide for the growth and health of the children.
					
					 They underlined the need to steadily raise the social concern and cognition of breastfeeding to improve the health of children and mothers.
					
					 Then, followed speeches titled "State benefits for women and children in DPRK and world trend of children's growth" and "Good points of foremilk and foremilk feeding".
					
					 The experience gained in health care for children was published at the symposium.

articles.title: DPRK Athlete Wins Gold Medals at Vietnam Track and Field Tournament
articles.content:
DPRK Athlete Wins Gold Medals at Vietnam Track and Field Tournament
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Son Hui, woman athlete of the DPRK, bagged two gold medals at the 2015 Vietnam International Track and Field Tournament held in Vietnam on August 1 and 2.
					 The tournament brought together more than 430 athletes from the DPRK, Vietnam, Indonesia, Singapore and other countries and regions.
					
					 She finished first in the women's 10 000m race on Sunday and in the women's 5 000m race held earlier.
					
					 Meanwhile, Pak Jin Hyang of the DPRK placed the second in the women's 5 000m race and 1 500m race.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Beats Its Japanese Rival
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Beats Its Japanese Rival
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The DPRK men's football team beat its Japanese rival 2:1 at the first day match of the 2015 EAFF East Asia Cup in Wuhan, China which will last till August 9.
					 The games that began on August 2 brought together football teams of the DPRK, China, Japan and south Korea.
					
					 Ri Hyok Chol and Pak Hyon Il of the DPRK team each scored goals at around 78th and 88th minutes.
					
					 The DPRK team will play the second match with its Chinese rival on Wednesday.

articles.title: 42 Schools Awarded Title of Model Physical Training School
articles.content:
42 Schools Awarded Title of Model Physical Training School
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- 42 schools were awarded the title of model physical training school in the DPRK in the first half of this year amid sports enthusiasm running high throughout the country.
					 Among them, seven teaching institutions, including Samchon Primary School in Samchon County, South Hwanghae Province, Kim Jong Hul Primary School in Kim Chaek City, North Hamgyong Province, were honored with the title of the twice model physical training school.
					
					 Those schools have gained big successes in organizing after-school sports activities and equipping themselves with different sports facilities.
					
					 The movement for winning the title of model physical training school is also gaining momentum at different units in the country.

articles.title: Big Efforts Paid to Prevention of Flood Damage in DPRK
articles.content:
Big Efforts Paid to Prevention of Flood Damage in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Efforts have been directed to preventing flood damage in the DPRK.
					 Pyongyang City completed bank revetment along the River Taedong, thus taking a lead in the campaign to prevent flood damage.
					
					 Cities and counties along the River Chongchon pushed ahead with embankment.
					
					 Kumchon County in North Hwanghae Province finished embankment projects reaching a length of thousands meters.
					
					 The Tongmun Co-op Farm in Huichon City, Jagang Province reinforced river wall at an interval of 700 meters to secure farmland against flood.
					
					 Hamju County in South Hamgyong Province is making a fast progress in different projects to prevent Kumjingang Hungbong Youth Power Station and other units from flood damage.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Brigandish Sophism of U.S. Nuclear War Maniacs
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Brigandish Sophism of U.S. Nuclear War Maniacs 
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S., already deceiving the world with its initiative of realizing a ''world without nuclear weapons,'' is conducting another deceptive campaign. It has busied itself officially designating the facilities related to the "Manhattan plan" as national historical park within this summer. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article says in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. committed indelible crime of mass killings before mankind and history yet it is advertising it as the "feats contributed to peace". This is brigandish sophism that only the worst nuclear war maniacs can make.
					
					 It is a crafty trick employed by the imperialists to call for "peace" in public and seek to ignite a war behind the curtain.
					
					 It is nonsensical for the U.S. to try to make the public convince that the plan of realizing a ''world without nuclear weapons'' has been botched owing to the DPRK. What's more impudent is that the nuclear maniacs are calling for the "maintenance of powerful nuclear deterrence".
					
					 It does not fit the U.S. to talk about the "nuclear deterrence" as it is the greatest nuclear weapons state in the world that has the history of having inflicted nuclear disaster upon mankind.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear weapons is an inevitable product caused by the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear blackmail policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy based on strength reassured the DPRK of the iron-willed truth that it has to counter with powerful nuclear deterrence the gangsters who brandish nuclear stick.
					
					 Only when nuclear deterrence is bolstered, will it be possible to guarantee peace.
					
					 Whatever farces the U.S. may orchestrate, the DPRK will not be stupefied but keep to the path chosen by itself.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Trumpeting about "Instability of Social System" in DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Trumpeting about "Instability of Social System" in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces, upset by the dynamic advance of the DPRK, are malignantly slandering it while spreading misinformation about it, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article. It goes on:
					 Shortly ago, the puppet chief executive of south Korea told a foreign delegation that international sanctions would "increase instability" of the DPRK and when interviewed by a U.S. media, she pulled up the DPRK, while vociferating about "source of instability".
					
					 The "instability of social system" much touted by the puppet forces is a product of foolish ambition of idiots utterly ignorant of their rival.
					
					 The word "instability of social system" is unworkable to the DPRK dignified with independence and emerging victorious in single-minded unity.
					
					 As far as the instability of social system is concerned, it is an unavoidable fate of the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 Scrambles for power among political forces under the present puppet regime and social confusion caused by it are attributable to the manipulation, plots and plans of the U.S. to realize its strategy for hegemony with south Korea as a springboard.
					
					 The puppet forces have served their U.S. master but this caused sustained political confusion, people's denunciation of the policy of treachery and the ever-worsening ruling crisis.
					
					 The present puppet ruling quarters are turning the whole of south Korea into a tundra of human rights and democracy where fascist dictatorship is rampant while calling back the departed soul of the "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 Their mud-slinging at the socialist system of the DPRK is nothing but a last-ditch effort of those facing the final doom.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Sinister Intention to Check Aug. 15 Joint Events
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Sinister Intention to Check Aug. 15 Joint Events 
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Now the south Korean puppet authorities try to give impression that they are allowing civilian organizations of south Korea to contact the north, while talking about "positive aid" to the August 15 joint events, being promoted by the civilian bodies in the north and the south. They, however, let a spokesman for the Ministry of Unification talk such wicked words that "it is difficult to allow political events." 
					 As already reported, the DPRK clarified that it would hold the "Conference for National Reunification Marking the 70th Anniversary of Country's Liberation" from Aug. 13 to 15 and other colorful events including the ceremony of launching the grand march for independent reunification on Mt. Paektu, sacred mountain of the nation, joint meeting for peace and reunification of Korea and pledge-taking meeting for independent reunification in Pyongyang and Panmunjom, and has flung its door open for all the representatives at home and abroad desirous to take part in the events. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group, however, is chilling the atmosphere for the joint events while trumpeting about "depoliticization," Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary says, stressing this is a cunning plot to check the joint events, being unpleased with them. 
					
					 The paper goes on:
					
					 Their talk about "depoliticization" is groundless sophism prompted by the sinister purpose to disturb the Aug. 15 joint events which have caught interest and on which expectation is put by Koreans at home and abroad, and thus escape from the responsibility for it. 
					
					 Their act of checking the joint events showed that their talk about "dialogue" is deception and a stop-gap measure to justify and intensify their moves for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north in collusion with outside forces. 
					
					 Steeped in to the marrow of bones of the south Korean authorities are only their ambition for confrontation with the fellow countrymen and for invasion of the north.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Scheming to Scuttle Joint National Events for Marking August 15
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Scheming to Scuttle Joint National Events for Marking August 15
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- After the DPRK issued a press release that a national conference for reunification would be held with splendor to mark August 15, the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, the south Korean puppet regime showed an ambiguous attitude toward the events.
					 The south Korean authorities, while paying lip-service to "positive support for the August 15 joint events" promoted by NGOs of the north and the south, if it take place, staged the farce of allowing the contact with NGOs of the north and, at the same time, let a spokesman for the Ministry of Unification bluster "it is hard to allow political events", an indication of its attempt to scuttle them.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are now under fire for aborting the June 15 joint national events. It is, therefore, their calculation that their open scuttling of the planned joint events against the backdrop of the desire for reunification growing stronger in the run-up to the 70th anniversary of national liberation would touch off bitterer criticism of the public at home and abroad.
					
					 Lurking behind their gesture is an ulterior intention to scuttle the joint events under the pretext of "depoliticization" and evade their responsibility for the abortive events by creating impressions that they would support the events in case the north and the south "exchange" their delegations to events in Pyongyang and Seoul.
					
					 As already reported, the North, South and Overseas Committees for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration decided to hold joint national events as grand festivals of weighty political significance and have discussed relevant issues from the outset of the year, reflecting the unanimous aspiration and desire of all Koreans to improve the north-south relations and pave a broad avenue to national reunification this year marking the 15th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration and the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					 In this course, preparatory committees composed of organizations and personages of various circles were inaugurated in the north, the south and abroad to mark the above-said anniversaries, and NGOs in the north, the south and abroad decided to hold the joint national events for marking June 15 in Seoul and those for marking August 15 in Pyongyang and pushed ahead with the preparations for successfully holding the events.
					
					 However, the south Korean regime, which has denied the joint declaration and refused to implement it, interfered even in the working contacts between the NGOs from the north, the south and abroad, pressurized the south side's preparatory committee to change the venue of the events already agreed upon and "depoliticize" the events. So, the events for marking June 15 had to be held separately in the north, the south and abroad.
					
					 As seen above, the puppet regime cried out for "depoliticizing" the joint events being prepared by the NGOs of the north and the south, not content with scuppering the hard-won opportunity of holding north-south dialogue and repairing the north-south relations. By doing so, the regime self-exposed that it has no will to ensure the events.
					
					 To hold with splendor the national conference for reunification to mark August 15 is a manifestation of the principled stand and invariable will of the DPRK to mend the north-south relations and pave a wide avenue to independent reunification at any cost under the banner of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The conference should serve as an important occasion for all Koreans to strikingly demonstrate their firm will and spirit to achieve independent reunification, recollecting the historical significance of Korea's liberation.
					
					 "Depoliticization" of the joint events marking August 15 touted by the south Korean puppet regime is no more than sheer sophism.
					
					 This can never be pardoned as it is a mockery and challenge to the aspiration and will of all Koreans to achieve national reconciliation and unity and open up a phase of independent reunification.
					
					 No matter what sleight of hand the puppet regime may employ, the national conference for reunification will be held with splendor amid interests of all fellow countrymen.

articles.title: S. Korean Women's Human Rights Violated in S. Korea
articles.content:
S. Korean Women's Human Rights Violated in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- South Korean media in editorials on July 30 deplored the miserable reality of the society in which women's human rights are wantonly violated.
					 The paper Hangyore referred to sexual crimes at the campuses.
					
					 The Kyunghyang Daily News said that female soldiers are falling victims to the sexual abuse within the puppet army.

articles.title: Sycophantic Acts of S. Korean Ruling Party's Representative under Fire
articles.content:
Sycophantic Acts of S. Korean Ruling Party's Representative under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. in a commentary on July 28 denounced the south Korean puppet ruling party's representative Kim Mu Song for committing sycophantic acts during his visit to the U.S.
					 The commentary said that Kim Mu Song, representative of the "Saenuri Party," group of traitors against the reunification, visited the U.S., made deep bows before the gravestone of the American soldiers who met death in the past Korean war and to the Americans, adding that there can be a report that Kim made a deep bow even to an American dog passing by.
					
					 It noted that his visit proved the fact that Kim is a typical flunkey and traitor who sold and betrayed his nation. 
					
					 It stressed that Kim should clearly know that his disgraceful behavior will bring him a curse that he is worse than a dog and severe punishment by the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech Introduced in Switzerland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech Introduced in Switzerland
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the study of the Juche Idea on July 27 separately posted on their websites the full text of the congratulatory speech made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the 4th National Conference of War Veterans.
					 The congratulatory speech, made on July 25, Juche 104 (2015), clarifies that July 27 of Korea is the second Day of Liberation when the Korean people defended with honour their country's dignity and sovereignty from the brigandish aggression by the U.S. imperialists, and also the day of proud victors that put the U.S. imperialists on a downhill march towards ruin.
					
					 It also says: The war veterans have devoted all their life to the independent reunification and prosperity of their country. Their ennobling fighting spirit and splendid patriotic feats will shine brilliantly in inerasable golden letters in the history of the heroic struggle of our people. 
					
					 The websites carried the photos of Kim Jong Un making the congratulatory speech at the 4th National Conference of War Veterans.

articles.title: V-Day of Korean People Observed by Peruvian Body
articles.content:
V-Day of Korean People Observed by Peruvian Body
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism released a statement on July 28 to observe the 62nd anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists ignited a war against the DPRK on June 25, 1950 in a bid to dominate Korea and other parts of Asia.
					
					 The great President Kim Il Sung led the Korean people's Fatherland Liberation War for defeating the U.S. imperialists and defending the sovereignty of the country to a victory.
					
					 Under his wise leadership the service personnel and people of the DPRK defeated the U.S. imperialists on July 27, 1953.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists, oblivious of the ignominious defeat in the Korean war, are getting desperate in their moves to provoke a new war against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists should accept the just proposal made by the DPRK to replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty for durable peace and stability on the Korean peninsula, and immediately withdraw their aggressor forces from south Korea.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visit Paid to DPRK Embassy in Nigeria
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visit Paid to DPRK Embassy in Nigeria
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, and his party paid a congratulatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Abuja on July 23 to mark the 62nd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together and paid highest tribute to them.
					
					 Meanwhile, the co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, the general manager of the Golden Trip Travel Service Co. Ltd., Hong Kong of China, the chairperson of the Emperor Group and the chief secretary of the Zhonghwa Energy Fund Commission sent floral baskets to the DPRK mission.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Czech Republic
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Czech Republic
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Czech Republic for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was formed in Prague on July 22.
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from July 27 to October 11 and decided to hold a seminar, meeting, photo exhibition, film show and other political and cultural events praising exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Anniversary of Liberation of Korea to Be Observed in Slovakia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Liberation of Korea to Be Observed in Slovakia
						
 Pyongyang, August 3 (KCNA) -- A Slovak preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation was inaugurated in Bratislava on July 28.
					 Ivan Draxler, chairman of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to significantly arrange political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary careers and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre varios campos de construccion
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre varios campos de construccion
						
Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, hizo detallado conocimiento en terreno de la marcha de la construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica Juventud Songun Paektusan y de la ferrovia Hyesan-Samjiyon.
					Estando en el campo de la construccion de dique de la Central Hidroelectrica Juventud Songun Paektusan No.1 y de la sala de generador de la No.2, asi como de la ferrovia Jesan-Samjiyon, reconocio detalladamente la marcha de la construccion, los preparativos de gestion y la situacion del suministro de materiales y convoco reuniones consultivas en las cuales fueron mencionados el significativo y la importancia de las dos obras, que tienen en el acondicionamiento de la zona de Samjiyon como la base de la educacion con la tradicion revolucionaria y con la idea revolucionaria.
					
					Se dio enfasis en los problemas de aumentar la proporcion de mecanizacion, terminar la construccion manteniendo los principios de responsabilizarse con mil anos y garantizar diez mil anos y suministrar con satisfaccion los materiales de construccion.
					
					Por otra parte, el premier recorrio varios objetivos de reconstruccion de la zona de la cabeza distrital de Samjiyon y tomo unas medidas correspondientes.

articles.title: Atleta de RPDC gana 2 medallas de oro en competencia internacional
articles.content:
Atleta de RPDC gana 2 medallas de oro en competencia internacional
						
Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- La atleta de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Son Hui, obtuvo las 2 medallas de oro en la Competencia Internacional Abierta de Atletismo de Vietnam 2015, que tuvo lugar en Vietnam.
					En la ocasion participaron mas de 400 corredores de ambos sexos provenientes de la RPDC, Vietnam, Indonesia, Singapur y otros paises y regiones.
					
					El dia 2, Kim ocupo el primer lugar en la carrera femenina de 10 mil metros. Mientras tanto, se adjudico primera en 5 mil metros.
					
					La Pak Jin Hyang ocupo el segundo lugar en la carrera de 5 mil y mil 500 metros, respectivamente.

articles.title: Tiene lugar seminario por semana de lactancia de 2015
articles.content:
Tiene lugar seminario por semana de lactancia de 2015
						
Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 3 en esta capital el seminario dedicado a la semana de lactancia de 2015.
					A la ocasion asistieron los funcionarios de la rama de salud publica, ministerios, organos centrales y prensa e informacion, asi como miembros de la representacion de la organizacion internacional inclusive el delegado del Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF).
					
					En el seminario hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores mencionaron que el mundo da importancia a la lactancia para el crecimiento y la salud de los ninos.
					
					Refirieron la necesidad de mejorar sin cesar la salud de los ninos y las madres al prestar atencion y comprension sociales a la lactancia.
					
					Hubo tambien seminarios intitulados "Beneficios para las mujeres y los ninos en la RPDC y la tendencia mundial del crecimiento de los ninos" y "Puntos positivos de primera leche y primera lactancia".
					
					En la ocasion fueron presentadas buenas experiencias adquiridas en la cria de los ninos.

articles.title: Actividades de deportes masivos en RPDC
articles.content:
Actividades de deportes masivos en RPDC 
Pyongyang, 3 de agosto (ACNC) -- En medio de las animadas actividades de deportes masivos, en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea 42 unidades a todos niveles recibieron el titulo de la Escuela Ejemplar en el Deporte.
					Entre ellas, la escuela primaria de Samchon del distrito homonimo de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, la escuela primaria Kim Jong Hul de la ciudad Kim Chaek de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte y otras 5 escuelas fueron condecoradas con el titulo de doble Escuela Ejemplar en el Deporte.
					
					La Universidad de Agricultura de Chongjin, la escuela secundaria basica de Taesin y la de Ryuldong del municipio Tongdaewon de la ciudad de Pyongyang y otros centros docentes elevaron la calidad de la clase de deportes y desplegaron ampliamente las actividades deportivas extraescolares, asi que se convirtieron en las unidades ejemplares en el deporte.
					
					Las unidades ejemplares lograron muchos exitos en el trabajo para preparar satisfactoriamente la base material inclusive los establecimientos y aparatos de deportes.
					
					Actualmente, los centros docentes condecorados con el titulo de Escuela Ejemplar en el Deporte hacen mayor esfuerzo para alcanzar la meta mas elevada y este fervor se expande a otras unidades.
